title: ALL my email for one account has totally gone! :(
creator: neildsc1
content:
Hi there,

I have Thunderbird on my laptop and map in to that three email accounts. One outlook and two plusnet.

On Wed 31st July this week when I did my daily look EVERYTHING for just one plusnet account has totally deleted. The shell of the email account is still present in the left hand pane, but no content at all. Nothing. All emails and folders and not in trash or anywhere. New emails are still coming in from that point.

On the plusnet online webmail portal they are also gone too.

The other two accounts are totally fine (including the other plusnet account).

I'm totally at a loss as to what happened. It was a totally normal day. I hope you can offer some insight. Thank you for your time. Neil

title: Mail perse ed impossibile scaricare le mail
creator: trusnic
content:
Buongiorno a tutti, dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento di qualche giorno fa (ora sono alla ver 128.0.1esr (32 bit)) Mozilla Thunderbird non mi scarica più la posta. Ho diverse caselle mail tra le quali Tiscali, OVH e Tophost ma nessuna di queste funziona. Dopo aver effettuato l'aggiornamento ho visto che non mi scaricava più la mail dalla mia casella Tophost (che ha sempre funzionato) ho così deciso di eliminare l'account mantenendo le mail per provare ad aggiungerlo nuovamente. Nonostante questo ho perso migliaia di email....l'account comunque continua a non funzionare. (l'errore che mi appare è "Il Server mail.nicolatrussardi.it si è disconnesso. Il server potrebbe essere non disponibile o potrebbe esserci stato un problema di rete.")

In un'altra casella email (ovh) mi segnala 13 messaggi non letti in Posta in arrivo ma ne vedo solamente 3 (già letti).

Qualcuno può indicarmi se c'è la possibilità di ripristinare una versione precedente? grazie mille

title: Thunderbird stopped working. "Get Messages" does nothing.
creator: firefox1115
content:
So yesterday everything was working fine, today Thunderbird is dead.

I run my own mail server. It's using a self signed certificate which never was a problem before - and I'm not sure it's the source of the problem now. When I click the "Get Messages" button, nothing happens. I'm not getting an error pop-up, nor an error message in the status bar at the bottom. Nothing happens. However, if I look in my mail server's log file, I see this appear:

2024-08-04T17:47:14.983935+02:00 enterprise dovecot: pop3-login: Disconnected: Connection closed (no auth attempts in 0 secs): user=<>, rip=<my ip address>, lip=<server's ip address>, TLS, session=<7SV7ed0eXTTVSYV6>

It doesn't matter if I try to retrieve mail through POP or IMAP. The exact same thing happens. It's not the mail server. I have another mail client and it is able to retrieve my mails just fine.

I deleted the account's passwords. Didn't help. I removed the Certificates. Didn't help.

So what's going on here?
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;product:thunderbird

title: Need help logging into GoDaddy email
creator: scott61
content:
Included is a screenshot of the most recent error message generated when I started up Thunderbird. This was requested by an email sent in response to my original request (below).

I will repeat ... I want to speak with someone DIRECTLY. That is much, much faster than the back and forth via email, and cuts down on lots of the misdirection and misunderstandings that occur.

I have a lot more info that may or may not be valuable to trouble shooting this issue. That can become clear with a phone call.

If this gets too frustrating attempting to get direct support via phone, I will likely just eventually give up and assume what I will assume.

I'd rather remain a Thunderbird user and restart my contributions supporting your awesome effort.

Scott [edited phone# from community support forum]

  • * * * * Earlier request below * * * *

I used to be a Thunderbird user, and donated every year. I stopped last year because GoDaddy updated their email servers, and my Thunderbird stopped being able to log in. I called GoDaddy support (~ Nov 2023) about it, and while they had a year or so earlier been able to help me with Thunderbird login, at the time (~ Nov 2023) they no longer had anyone who understood Thunderbird very well.

Since then I have only accessed GoDaddy email via my Firefox browser. However, I want to get back to using Thunderbird.

I want to work with someone from Thunderbird interactively over the phone to achieve a successful login and integration with the GoDaddy email server using my Thunderbird application.

I am running Windows 10 on a DELL laptop. GoDaddy email server is Microsoft 365.

I am fairly technically competent, and so I can be quick on the phone to verify all is working well. If successful, I will send a donation to Thunderbird within 24 hours.

Please respond personally. Automated responses are generally fairly irritating, because they often don't answer the issues I am having. You know what I mean.

Looking forward to hearing from you. Please send a phone number that I can call. Or you can text me or reach me at [edited phone# from community support forum]

Thanks much,

Scott
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:128.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/128.0;product:thunderbird

title: Potential loss of huge quantities of historic emails...
creator: mark566
content:
Hi

I am UK user of Thunderbird and have been for many years...

I am likely to be the cause of my own problem as I have allowed my live email folders to accumulate thousands of emails... in excess of 26,000 in my inbox alone...

I have recently started to try to tidy these up as I need to transfer my data to a new PC. however, before attempting to copy the first batch of emails to a new local folder, I noticed that there appeared to be substantial gaps in my email folders with vast tracts of emails appearing to be missing.

I went on online to my email provider (fasthosts) and it seemed that the solution might be to refresh the emails... Sadly, this seemed to make matters worse.

It now appears that I am missing even larger numbers of historic emails (both from my inbox and from my received folder). We are talking 1000's of emails that have simply disappeared... Seemingly without trace.

I suspect any advice and instructions will be beyond my scope... Are there any support services available to UK users where sufficiently competent professionals can provide assistance to users who have clearly got out of their depth.
metadata: ;category:troubleshooting;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/127.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/127.0.0.0;product:thunderbird;solver_id:181052

title: lost access to address book
creator: wes19
content:
My Pop!OS Linux platform recently upgraded Thunderbird to version 128.0.1esr and in the process it lost access to my address book. Trying to get the address book back I encounter the attached prompt to choose the address book file format from a list.

I strongly suggest that somewhere in the process there is a "import previous address book after upgrade" or something like that. The reason is that I, like other busy users, do not know what file format is used by Thunderbird or for that matter where the address book resides. But hey, we're being asked by Thunderbird itself, shouldn't Thunderbird know these answers? Just have a choice "click to re-connect address book after Thunderbird upgrade" or something like that.

BTW I contribute financially to Thunderbird.

title: Thunderbird email address @mailfence.com has been stopped  after I cancelled renewal on 9th September
creator: jnbs
content: I installed email provider Mailfence as it was recommended by Thunderbird as a good free provider, only to find out that if used with Thunderbird it charged for the service. After the first year I have decided to cancel and have informed them that at the end of the term on 9th September I will not be renewing, and later on the same day i find i have no service with them. My contract which I paid for runs out on 9th September so i have another month to ensure all contacts are aware of the closure of the account. I feel Thunderbird needs to be aware of their deceit and if possible make them comply with their contractual obligations, and determine whether they are fit to be recommended.

title: Emailaccount instellingen
creator: flonk1
content: Bij het wijzigen van de email account instellingen van Hotmail.com en Outlook.com zie ik alleen voor de pop en imap servers een optie Oauth2. Voor de SMTP servers is deze instelling niet aanwezig maar dat zou wel moeten volgens de opgave van Micosoft. Kunt u mij vertellen hoe ik ook voor SMTP de optie Oauth2 kan instellen? Bij voorbaar dank, Flonk

title: Incorrect email count
creator: lynxstch01
content: Thunderbird is telling me I have 13 new and unread emails. I have zero new and unread mails. I have looked in my ISP's email program and all of my emails are read. None are new. Is there some issue going on all of a sudden? It's very confusing.
